intro: Neocuatrecasia cuzcoensis, commonly known as the Cuzco endemic tree, is a rare and unique species native to the Andean region of Peru. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and distinctive foliage. The plant exhibits a complex branching pattern and possesses small, clustered leaves with a leathery texture. It produces unique inflorescences that are typical of the Euphorbiaceae family, featuring cyathia with yellowish-green flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Neocuatrecasia cuzcoensis is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
